fields.description:
When registering an image you can specify mappings for devices/snapshots. If more than one mapping is specified then a binding error occurs:

# euca-register -n TEST -b /dev/sda1=snap-00000001 -b /dev/sdb=snap-00000002
412 Precondition Failed: Failed to bind the following fields:
BlockDeviceMapping.2.Ebs.SnapshotId = snap-00000001
BlockDeviceMapping.2.DeviceName = /dev/sda1
BlockDeviceMapping.2.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination = true
fields.summary: Binding error when registering image with multiple device mappings

comments.body:
This issue occurs with the Query API, this functionality should still be available via the SOAP API.

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-soap-api.html

I should have a fix for review tomorrow. I just have some more testing to do.
The problem seems to be that some parameters were not being handled properly in 
BaseQueryBinding.populateObjectList
Great, thanks, Michael. Am I reading this right that this will get into 3.2, or is this targeted to 3.2.x?

Code Review Request :EUCA-2264 Binding error when registering image with multiple device mappings

Hi All,

May I please request a code review for EUCA-2264
Binding error when registering image with multiple device mappings

branch :
dev/mmunn1/EUCA-2264

diff :
git show --color 

summary: EUCA-2264 Binding error when registering image with multiple device mappings.
The error 412 Precondition Failed: Failed to bind the following fields: ....
was being thrown when euca-register was called with multiple device mappings.

fix: The problem was that only the first device mapping was being removed from the params array in
BaseQueryBinding.populateObjectList(...). The fix is to remove all of the params.

Unit test : (same code path as euca-register)

Pass: should start without error

euca-run-instances emi-41583EE6  -b /dev/sdb1=:20 -b /dev/sdb2=:20
 
Fail:

euca-run-instances emi-41583EE6  -b /dev/sdb1=:20 -b /dev/sdb2=:20
412 Precondition Failed: Failed to bind the following fields:
BlockDeviceMapping.2.DeviceName = /dev/sdb2
BlockDeviceMapping.2.Ebs.VolumeSize = 20
BlockDeviceMapping.2.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination = true

Eutester testcase = testcases/cloud_admin/Euca2264

Thx Mike
Nice work Mike!  Glad to see this one in review.
This fix only addresses the binding error not any underlying bfebs issues

The fix for binding errors drops device mappings other than the first, this can result in errors registering an image when multiple device mappings are used. The example below shows registering an image and then attempting to register again after adding another device mapping:

{code}
# euca-register --snapshot snap-B9C03DED --root-device-name /dev/sda1 -n TEST -d TESTDESC -b /dev/sda1=snap-B9C03DED --kernel eki-24F23A88 -a x86_64 
IMAGE	emi-7F1F41B3
# euca-describe-images 
IMAGE	emi-B1153E98	image/fedora-16-x86_64.manifest.xml	013765657871	available	private		x86_64	machine	eki-24F23A88			instance-store
IMAGE	emi-7F1F41B3	013765657871/TEST	013765657871	available	private		x86_64	machine	eki-24F23A88			ebs
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda1	snap-B9C03DED	1
IMAGE	eki-24F23A88	image/vmlinuz-3.6.5-2.fc16.x86_64.manifest.xml	000000000001	available	private		x86_64	kernel				instance-store
# euca-register --snapshot snap-B9C03DED --root-device-name /dev/sda1 -n TEST -d TESTDESC -b /dev/sda1=snap-B9C03DED -b /dev/sdb=snap-FE3C3D6E --kernel eki-24F23A88 -a x86_64 
RegisterImageType: Malformed registration. A request must specify either a manifest path or a snapshot to use for BFE. Provided values are: imageLocation=null blockDeviceMappings=[[class:class edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.BlockDeviceMappingItemType, virtualName:null, ebs:[volumeSize:null, snapshotId:snap-FE3C3D6E, class:class edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.EbsDeviceMapping, deleteOnTermination:true, virtualName:null, metaClass:org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.HandleMetaClass@12e6de50[groovy.lang.ExpandoMetaClass@12e6de50[class edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.EbsDeviceMapping]]], size:null, metaClass:org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.HandleMetaClass@730d5fe1[groovy.lang.ExpandoMetaClass@730d5fe1[class edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.BlockDeviceMappingItemType]], format:null, deviceName:/dev/sdb]]
{code}

The fix silently drops information supplied by the user, IMO a better approach is to fail (with a clear error) than to continue and possibly fail due to an even more cryptic error such as the above.
[~sjones] so it sounds like are you saying that this fix fails.  I would tend to agree if it causes other issues.  If so we need to assign it back to [~mmunn1]

[~tony] in my opinion it is best to revert the fix, but note that with the fix in place the originally described issue no longer occurs.

[~mmunn1] I think that it is best not to make changes for 3.2 other than revert the fix if we decide that is appropriate. I don't see any value in just suppressing the error (suppressing the error seems like the worst thing to do, since then it is not obvious that the underlying functionality is broken)
[~sjones], [~mmunn1] how about this: leave the original "fix" in and I can verify this issue *and* open a new issue for the silently dropping information consequence which will not be 3.2 critical.
[~tony], that works for me. In that case, I'll also open a new issue for supporting registration of an image with multiple device mappings.

Fix verified:
Version     : 3.2.0
Release     : 0.0.346.20121121git51a01cd5.el6

Note: raises another issue which will be filed, if a user supplies multiple bindings euca will silently drop all after the first.
